product_name: Innersense Organic BeautyQuiet Calm Curl Control Cream
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackInnersense Organic Beauty's Quiet Calm Curl Control Cream is a nourishing styling cream to hydrate, shape and define curls.
details: DetailsBenefitsHydratesShapes and defines curlsEliminates frizzSmooths textured hairKey IngredientsRice Bran Oil and Rooibos Tea to strengthen and define curlsShea Butter to moisturize and eliminate frizzFormulated WithoutPhthalatesEthoxylatesSulfatesSilicones1,4 dioxaneParabensPetro compoundsPropylene and butylene glycolPEGMEATEAMIAEDTA artificial dyesSynthetic fragrancesItem 2572249How To UseTake a deep breath and become centered. Apply a pea size amount to wet hands and gently rake through wet hair to separate and shape curls. Diffuse or air dry. For smooth, straight styles, apply to damp hair and blow dry.IngredientsWater, Glycerin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cetyl Alcohol, Glyceryl Stearate, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis Peel Oil*, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter)*, Gluconolactone, Calcium Gluconate, Sorbitol Powder, Cetrimonium Chloride, Tocopherol, Potassium Sorbate, Nelumbium Speciosum (Lotus) Flower Oil*, Plumeria Alba (Frangipani) Flower Extract, Avena Sativa (Oat) Seed Extract, Vaccinium Macrocarpon (Cranberry) Seed Oil*, Plumeria Alba (Frangipani) Flower Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria) Flower Extract*, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Extract*, Ginkgo Biloba Leaf Extract*, Aspalathus Linearis Leaf Extract*, Schoenanthus (Lemongrass) Extract*, Honey Extract*, Sodium Benzoate, Citric Acid, Vaccinium Macrocarpon (Cranberry) Seed Oil, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Linalool+, Limonene+.* Certified Organic+A natural component of essential oilsShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Take a deep breath and become centered. Apply a pea size amount to wet hands and gently rake through wet hair to separate and shape curls. Diffuse or air dry. For smooth, straight styles, apply to damp hair and blow dry.
ingredients: Limonene+.* Certified Organic+A natural component of essential oils

reviews.headline: My latest fave!
reviews.comments:
I am a curly girl, so I rely on and trust my hairstylist to the Moon & back, and on a recent visit they recommended Innersense.
It's been a great new daily go-to, and I love the subtle scent.

reviews.headline: awesome!
reviews.comments: I really like this hair cream I just need to make sure my hair has enough water . I use a small amount . it doesn't leave any film or product on my scalp like other do. The smell is not strong like I thought it was going to be so is nice.

reviews.headline: Hair Looks Extremely Dry
reviews.comments:
This created a lot of frizz and zapped the moisture from my hair. Two days after my wash day, my hair looked like it was on Day  5. It was frizzy and dry.

I tried a different conditioner and reapplied it today, and my hair was still extremely dry looking. I applied my other curl cream on top and added extra gel which brought back the definition in my hair.

I have coily hair that's soft and defined normally, but this messed it up. It might have enough moisture for curly and wavy hair textures! It has a nice creamy texture overall.

reviews.headline: Clean and moisturizing
reviews.comments: Nice, clean, moisturizing hair milky cream great for styling hair. It's a bit pricey but i got my products on sale.

reviews.headline: perfect
reviews.comments: i have type 4 natural hair and i just cut it again. i wanted to use a different cream for my twist outs and opted for this. i used ir in combination wirh Donna's recipe leave in and The Doux honey mousse (only in some areas) and it worked beautifully! it was suped moisturizing (even in areas where i didnt use mousse. my tip would be to follow the directions on the product for the best results and make sure to check that additional products mix well with the cream

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: I was given a sample of this product and I absolutely love it. I apply it after my leave in conditioner. I brush it through before brush styling. It helps hold the shape of the curl until I add gel. I will purchase this product in the future.

reviews.headline: Not what I needed
reviews.comments: This may work for some with curlier hair but it didn't have enough hold to support my loosely wavy hair. Love the ingredients just wasn't what I needed in a curl/styling cream. I think it's a bit too heavy for my hair.

reviews.headline: Love this line of products
reviews.comments: I use this with the I create definition mousse, and I create hold gel. Very good definition, no frizz. It's expensive, but I don't need to use a lot!!!!

reviews.headline: Best for soft curls
reviews.comments: I love this curl cream. I have a mix of wavy and curly hair and this gives me soft curls all over without feeling crunchy or frizzy.

reviews.headline: Love this !
reviews.comments: Most reviews I read were bad but after trying this for myself I can say it works great on my 3c/4a hair. It's difficult to find things that work well for my multi textured hair but this is great ! Remember to drench your hair with water first, it melts into your hair like butter.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: Barely there citrusy fragrance, no synthetic fragrance, excellent moisture—yes please! Four stars only because it's probably a little heavy for my lightweight curls, but I use it in combination with the I Create Hold gel and man—does it ever!

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: It gave me dandruff and the definition of my curls was not great

reviews.headline: Love this product
reviews.comments: I absolutely love this product. I use it after getting excess water out (after shower) with a t-shirt then apply before my hair gets dry. It leaves my curls defined and feels light. It holds for the entire day!

reviews.headline: Not enough on its own, but I love it when layering
reviews.comments:
my hair is very fine, low porosity and really dry. I tried this product first by itself with no other styling products just to see what I was working with, it tamed the frizz a little and had a small amount of hold but didn't last past a couple hours and past that it was like I didn't have any product in my hair at all. Next I layered it in under my usual stylrr (Miss Jessie's Jelly Soft Curls) and I got the soft bouncy curls I was looking for! My hair was way better with this underneath than just using Jelly Soft Curls alone! 

I use this Innersense product more like a leave-in conditioner, after my shower I squeeze all the extra water out of my hair then comb this through from root to tips. I add just a touch more water to get my curls to clump again and then micro plop as much moisture out as I can get with a really good microfiber cloth. Last to go on is the Jelly Soft Curls and I diffuser dry. I'm so glad I cracked the code with this Innersense cream since it's really expensive, now I don't style without it.

reviews.headline: Organic besuty
reviews.comments: Definitely my favorite clean organic brand for hair products!

reviews.headline: Frizzy hair.
reviews.comments: Left my hair frizzy. No defined curls.

reviews.headline: No hold for curls that need "help"
reviews.comments: This product smells good and gave me SUCH defined curls to the root. However, it only lasted about 10 minutes after diffusing, as this product has no hold. My curls were frizzy and undefined the rest of the day. I hope they make a gel version of this for curls that need help binding. I have 2C/3A curls and I'm white and Asian.

reviews.headline: Love the definition, no slip
reviews.comments: I actually really like this product. The smell isn't my favorite, but it's light enough that it's not offensive. I like this because it provides definition for my 3C curls, without needing gel as well. I end up with soft curls regardless of if I 'seal' them in! After using this product exclusively to style my hair for the past 2 weeks, the one thing I have been more aware of is its lack of slip. It doesn't make my hair feel silky, and I feel like I should wash it more - it almost feels like there's a build up. But! I will say, it seems to rinse fairly clean and maybe this is part of what its like to use all natural products? Silicone added a lot of slip to my hair before I used this product, but that also causes build up, so who knows. Anyway, at the rate I'm using the product and with how expensive it is, I've recently started using it alongside a cheaper drugstore leave in conditioner to help extend the life of the bottle, and it's still doing it's thing! The price point is a bit high, but it does work wonders on my hair, just not sure if I'd say it's doing better than my drugstore faves.

reviews.headline: Better choices out there
reviews.comments: I have tried this product by their own and didn't like the results. I would apply it and look good for a couple of minutes once I let it dry it made my hair frizzy, and would look like I blowed dried my hair with no product. I tried to pair it with other products I know worked well with my hair the results still were the same.

reviews.headline: I will buy this product again
reviews.comments: use this product as a replacement for another that is discontinued. I only used it twice, and so far so good. I will stay with this product now. I noticed the brand with someone else, who has more curls than mine. It keeps my hair soft. I use it when my hair is very wet and let it air dry.

faceoff_positive.comments: I actually really like this product. The smell isn't my favorite, but it's light enough that it's not offensive. I like this because it provides definition for my 3C curls, without needing gel as well. I end up with soft curls regardless of if I 'seal' them in! After using this product exclusively to style my hair for the past 2 weeks, the one thing I have been more aware of is its lack of slip. It doesn't make my hair feel silky, and I feel like I should wash it more - it almost feels like there's a build up. But! I will say, it seems to rinse fairly clean and maybe this is part of what its like to use all natural products? Silicone added a lot of slip to my hair before I used this product, but that also causes build up, so who knows. Anyway, at the rate I'm using the product and with how expensive it is, I've recently started using it alongside a cheaper drugstore leave in conditioner to help extend the life of the bottle, and it's still doing it's thing! The price point is a bit high, but it does work wonders on my hair, just not sure if I'd say it's doing better than my drugstore faves.
faceoff_positive.headline: Love the definition, no slip

faceoff_negative.comments: Purchased for my thick somewhat course, somewhat frizzy, somewhat curly hair. Find that my hair feels heavy, almost wet after using it (using only a dime to a nickle size dollap). It's not particularly frizzy hair weather here in new york. The real test will be in April when the humidity kicks up. I use this to help straighten my hair when I blow it out. If I use too much my hair looks like a grease pit, but the ingredient profile is so good and so clean that I can't give it up completely. Feel the same way about the conditioner and shampoo that I purchased for my hair type, but again, the product is clean and I feel good rubbing something so healthy for me into my scalp. Just not thrilled with how my hair feels after using it. It feels heavy which isn't bad as long as the frizz is controlled but it is fuller which isn't what I wanted. I have a lot of body and a lot of hair (I'm blessed). I wanted something to give me a sleek controlled flippy look when I blow it out. Really on the fence about all of my Innersense products. But I thinks its great that you make such clean healthy products. Just not in love with how my hair feels and looks. :(
faceoff_negative.headline: Not sure...
